Definition in file N_AddressManager.h.

Function Documentation

N_AddressManager_Status_t N_AddressManager_AssignAddressRange ( uint16_t  dealAddrFirst,
uint16_t  dealAddrLast,
uint16_t  dealGroupFirst,
uint16_t  dealGroupLast 
)

Sets an address range and a group identifier range (obtained from another device)

Parameters:
dealAddrFirst[in] The first address that can be dealt
dealAddrLast[in] The last address that can be dealt
dealGroupFirst[in] The first group identifier that can be dealt
dealGroupLast[in] The last group identifier that can be dealt
Returns:
Indicates success

This function must only be called with address ranges obtained from another device's Address Manager (using AllocateAddressesForDealer). A virgin device automatically starts with a full address range.

Note:
Call with all zeroes to make the address and group id pool of the device empty. The device is only capable of handing out random values after this
bool N_AddressManager_HasFreeGroupIds ( void  )

Returns TRUE if there are group identifiers available

Returns:
TRUE if group identifiers available in the pool, FALSE otherwise
N_AddressManager_Status_t N_AddressManager_AllocateGroupId ( uint16_t *  pGroupId)

Allocates a group identifier for the caller

Parameters:
*pGroupId[out] The group identifier allocated for the caller
Returns:
Indication of success.
void N_AddressManager_GetFreeGroupIdRange_Impl ( uint16_t *  idBegin,
uint16_t *  idEnd 
)

Get the current valid FreeGroupIdRangeBegin and idEnd possible

Parameters:
addresspointers to idBegin and idEnd
N_AddressManager_Status_t N_AddressManager_AllocateAddresses ( uint8_t  numGroups,
uint16_t *  pAddr,
uint16_t *  pGroupIdFirst 
) [private]

Allocates a short address and group identifiers for a non-assignment-capable device

Parameters:
numGroups[in] The number of group identifiers to allocate for the device
*pAddr[out] The short address allocated for the device itself
*pGroupIdFirst[out] The start of the allocated group identifier range for the device
Returns:
Indication of success.
N_AddressManager_Status_t N_AddressManager_AllocateAddressesForDealer ( uint8_t  numGroups,
uint16_t *  pAddr,
uint16_t *  pGroupIdFirst,
uint16_t *  pDealAddrFirst,
uint16_t *  pDealAddrLast,
uint16_t *  pDealGroupFirst,
uint16_t *  pDealGroupLast 
) [private]

Allocates a short address and group identifiers for an assignment-capable device, plus ranges of addresses and group identifiers for the Address Manager of that device

Parameters:
numGroups[in] The number of group identifiers to allocate for the device, must be 1
*pAddr[out] The short address allocated for the device itself
*pGroupIdFirst[out] The start of the allocated group identifier range for the device
*pDealAddrFirst[out] The first address for the Address Manager of the other device
*pDealAddrLast[out] The last address for the Address Manager of the other device
*pDealGroupFirst[out] The first group identifier for the Address Manager of the other device
*pDealGroupLast[out] The last group identifier for the Address Manager of the other device
Returns:
Indication of success.
Note:
short addresses and group identifiers range must be kept the same for now
